fr.sii.ogham.email.builder

Class EmailBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.email.builder.EmailBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<ConditionalSender>, MessagingSenderBuilder<ConditionalSender>

    public class EmailBuilder
extends Object
implements MessagingSenderBuilder<ConditionalSender>

    Specialized builder for email sender.

    There exists several implementations to send an email:
    • Using pure Java mail API
    • Using Apache Commons Email
    • Using any other library
    • Through SendGrid
    • Through a WebService
    • ...

    This builder provides a MultiImplementationSender. The aim of the MultiImplementationSender is to choose the best implementation for sending the email according to the runtime environment (detection of libraries in the classpath, availability of a particular property, ...).

    This builder lets you the possibility to register any new implementation. It allows you to enable or not templating support and automatic filling of message values (like sender address for example).

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet
    See Also:
    EmailSender, JavaMailBuilder

      • useDefaults

        public EmailBuilder useDefaults()
        Tells the builder to use all default behaviors and values:
        • Uses Java mail default behaviors and values
        • Registers Java mail API implementation
        • Enables automatic filling of message based on configuration properties
        • Enables templating support
        • Enables attachment features (see withAttachmentFeatures())

        Configuration values come from system properties.

        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • useDefaults

        public EmailBuilder useDefaults(Properties properties)
        Tells the builder to use all default behaviors and values:
        • Uses Java mail default behaviors and values
        • Registers Java mail API implementation
        • Enables automatic filling of message based on configuration properties
        • Enables templating support
        • Enables attachment features (see withAttachmentFeatures())

        Configuration values come from provided properties.

        Parameters:
        properties - the properties to use instead of default ones
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • registerImplementation

        public EmailBuilder registerImplementation(Condition<Message> condition,
                                           MessageSender implementation)
        Register a new implementation for sending email. The implementation is associated to a condition. If the condition evaluation returns true at runtime then it means that the implementation can be used. If several implementations are available, only the first implementation is really invoked.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition that indicates at runtime if the implementation can be used or not
        implementation - the implementation to register
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • registerImplementation

        public EmailBuilder registerImplementation(Condition<Message> condition,
                                           Builder<? extends MessageSender> builder)
        Register a new implementation for sending email. The implementation is associated to a condition. If the condition evaluation returns true at runtime then it means that the implementation can be used. If several implementations are available, only the first implementation is really invoked.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition that indicates at runtime if the implementation can be used or not
        builder - the builder for the implementation to register
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

        • Java mail API implementation

        Configuration values come from system properties.

        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • withJavaMail

        public EmailBuilder withJavaMail(Properties properties)
        Enable Java Mail API implementation. This implementation is used only if the associated condition indicates that Java Mail API can be used. The condition checks if:
        • The property mail.smtp.host is set
        • The class javax.mail.Transport (Java Mail API) is available in the classpath
        • The class com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport (Java Mail implementation) is available in the classpath
        The registration can silently fail if the javax.mail jar is not in the classpath. In this case, the Java Mail API is not registered at all.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties used to check if property exists
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • withSendGrid

        public EmailBuilder withSendGrid(Properties properties)
        Enable SendGrid implementation. This implementation is used only if the associated condition indicates that Java Mail API can be used. The condition checks if:
        • The property ogham.email.sendgrid.api.key is set
        • The property ogham.email.sendgrid.username and ogham.email.sendgrid.password is set
        • The class com.sendgrid.SendGrid is available in the classpath
        The registration can silently fail if the javax.mail jar is not in the classpath. In this case, the SendGrid is not registered at all.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties used to check if property exists
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • withAutoFilling

        public EmailBuilder withAutoFilling(MessageFillerBuilder builder)
        Enables automatic filling of emails with values that come from multiple sources. It let you use your own builder instead of using default behaviors.
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder for constructing the message filler
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • withAutoFilling

        public EmailBuilder withAutoFilling(Properties props,
                                    String baseKey)
        Enables automatic filling of emails with values that come from multiple sources:
        • Fill email with values that come from provided configuration properties.
        • Generate subject for the email (see SubjectFiller)
        See MessageFillerBuilder.useDefaults(Properties, String) for more information.

        Automatically called by useDefaults() and useDefaults(Properties)

        Parameters:
        props - the properties that contains the values to set on the email
        baseKey - the prefix for the keys used for filling the message
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • withAutoFilling

        public EmailBuilder withAutoFilling(Properties props)
        Enables automatic filling of emails with values that come from multiple sources:
        • Fill email with values that come from provided configuration properties. It uses the default prefix for the keys ("ogham.email").
        • Generate subject for the email (see SubjectFiller)

        Automatically called by useDefaults() and useDefaults(Properties)

        Parameters:
        props - the properties that contains the values to set on the email
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

        public EmailBuilder withTemplate(ContentTranslatorBuilder builder)
        Enables templating support using the provided ContentTranslatorBuilder. It decorates the email sender with a ContentTranslatorSender.
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder to use for constructing the ContentTranslator instead of using the default one

        this instance for fluent use

      • withAttachmentFeatures

        public EmailBuilder withAttachmentFeatures()
        Enable attachment features like attachment resolution based on lookup mapping. It delegates to AttachmentResourceTranslatorBuilder with the default behavior and values (see AttachmentResourceTranslatorBuilder.useDefaults()).

        Automatically called by useDefaults() and useDefaults(Properties)

        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • getImplementationBuilder

        public <B extends Builder<? extends MessageSender>> B getImplementationBuilder(Class<B> clazz)
        Get reference to the specialized builder. It may be useful to fine tune a specific implementation.
        Type Parameters:
        B - the type of the class to get
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class of the builder to get
        Returns:
        the builder instance for the specific implementation
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when provided class references an nonexistent builder
